snippet: With the inclusion of teams like Iona, Colorado State and Brigham Young, one could argue that the N.C.A.A. tournament selection committee is becoming more open-minded about lower-profile leagues.
abstract: Analysis on NCAA men's college basketball tournament selection; holds that the inclusion of 11 teams from outside the power conferences assures plenty of upsets, which gives March its unique flavor; also notes that selection suggests that the committee is becoming more open-minded about lower-profile leagues; chart of men's bracket.
lead_paragraph: With the inclusion of teams like Iona, Colorado State and Brigham Young, one could argue that the N.C.A.A. tournament selection committee is becoming more open-minded about lower-profile leagues.

headline.seo: N.C.A.A. Analysis: Lower-Profile Teams No Longer Overlooked
headline.main: Lower Profile, but No Longer Overlooked by N.C.A.A.
headline.print_headline: Lower Profile, But No Longer Overlooked
